text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Problems in right-wing Democratic Rally will be discussed at its political committee which convenes in 10 days time.
- U.S. President Bill Clinton reaffirms his commitment for a solution to the Cyprus problem.
- Cyprus's electricity authority modifies terms of the tender for the construction of a new power station at Vassiliko to suit a specific company.
- The government will push for the deregulation of interest rates in 1996.
- Britain's envoy on Cyprus David Hannay sets a target of April or May for a meeting between President Glafcos Clerides and Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash paralell to secret proximity talks.
- Large landowners got relaxations to building coefficient legislation while regulations have tightened for others, says the chairman of small communities.
- Demonstration at the Ledra Palace checkpoint discourages tourists from visiting the north.
- British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind is to convey a clear message during his visit that Britain wants to give the Cyprus problem a new push.
- Unions are on a collision course with the government over draft legislation banning strikes in essential services.
